learning_objective: Take on varying roles, with teacher guidance, when collaborating with peers during the design, implementation, and review stages of program development.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Faye is working on a team to develop a new mobile game. Each team member has a specific role. Alex is a back-end developer and has built a solid database. However, the front-end design isn't user-friendly and players are dropping from the game as a result. Alex knows they can fix the front-end problem, but doing so means stepping outside of their role. What should Alex do?",
    "Answer1": "Alex should ignore the problem because it's not their role to fix the front-end design.",
    "Answer2": "Alex should fix the front-end without telling anyone because they don't want to upset the front-end developer.",
    "Answer3": "Alex should talk to the team leader or bring up at the next team meeting that they have some ideas to improve the front-end design.",
    "Answer4": "Alex should quit the team because the front-end designer isn't doing their job.",
    "CorrectAnswer": "3",
    "Explanation": "While it is important to respect the roles and responsibilities within a team, it is also beneficial to share ideas and solutions that can improve the project. A clear communication is the key in such situations."
}
